reviewText: I just finished watching Gothika (2003) and am now watching Ghost Ship (2002) for the umpteenth time and I can never get enough of these movies Queen of the Damned has also become a favorite. Dreamcatcher was not that great at first watch, but subsequent watches made it a great movie. I recommend

I have yet to watch Dreamcatcher but I bought this for the other three movies, and for the price it was well worth it. The only complaint I have, and for some it may be a positive, is that the movies are on two discs instead of four, as it says in the description. I personally like having all of my movies separated but it does add space in the DVD binder. Overall I recommend this product to anyone interested, even if you only want one of the movies.

I recommend this to ANYONE who loves horror films!
Was such a good deal for 4 movies my family couldn't pass up. We love family time so this was a great find.

As with any movie, or collection, it depends what your personal preferences are.

All these movies are what I'd describe as horror mystery thrillers. I certainly wouldn't class any of them as "PG".

Gothica is well written, well directed, reasonable acting with a decent storyline. The sets are good, the costumes and make up excellent, there's really nothing that takes your attention away from the movie being presented by screaming "fake" at you when you're just getting engrossed.

Queen of the Damned likewise shares the good points from Gothica while being a vampire based movie. The story here is very far fetched but spun in such a way as to be totally engrossing within the frame presented.

Dreamcatcher has a more oblique storyline decent directing and average acting. It's very much a different take on the genere, but one which I thoroughly enjoyed and having watched it I'm surprised it didn't do a little better at the box office.

Ghost Ship was the better storyline, but was let down in some other respects, though it had an interesting twist at the finale. This movie certainly takes the watcher into the real of "not everything is always what it seems".

All in all a decent collection, with no movie falling into the 'B' category. Not a bad buy overall, I'd recommend it for anyone who likes the genere.

I had these movies on vhs once upon a time.  I was very pleased to be able to purchase all four on dvd a such a good price!

I bought this because of Ghost Ship, a spooky film with a great cast (Gabriel Byrne, Julainne Margoils, Karl Urban), and it still holds up, though the movie it rips off, the Event Horizon is still the better film. Gothika features a great Academy Award winning performance by Haley Berry, Rober Downey Jr. is also in it before his career comeback in Iron Man. Queen of the Damned provides interest only because its lead died so tragically as the movie was released: the premise of the movie, a vampire as a rock star, well, it really isn't explored, and Dreamcatcher makes absolutely no sense at all, it has to be one of Stephen KIng's worst works. All films are worth seeing, at least!
How could anyone not like having 4 good movies (if you like this kind of stuff) for about 5 bucks?  These are all well acted and well made dark thriller/horror genre.

The movies are great for the price, but watching them on a 4k TV is a little disappointing. You can notice the HUGE difference between the sound quality and the video quality. In either case, you can still enjoy the movies and all the extra content is still available.
